title: Helping Others Improve! EP 22! (Scary gank from blue buff!)

embed.description: He just survived that scary invade! -- Twitter: https://twitter.com/YaseiDoubutsu Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/YaseiDoubutsuXD/ Pateron: https://t.co/pQ5xovdbqe -- This is part of a series, where I try and help others go from Bronze to silver. Heck maybe even gold. I'm not the one playing, I'm spectating a game. If you are bronze and want some help, let me know.

body:
Once again, let me know if I missed anything.
And what this guy could have done better!

replies.body:
I like the whole idea, except the way you talk to the people you are trying to help, you give good information on what they should do instead of they are doing however you seem to be a bit aggressive toward the people you are helping. 
Some people tend to deter from people who talk down to them even if they are trying to help.
Other than that, it was pretty good so keep it up.

Apparently its helpful, that's what I've been told.
By others, and the ones I help.

Its kinda like "Harsh Love".
I don't flame them, or abuse them in anyway.
Most I get is, that's kinda silly and stupid.

It is definitely helpful, however there is some direct swearing and stuff.
However it's up to you whether you want to change that part because the tough love approach does work and can be amusing to see in practice as well.
maybe do commentary while not showing the whole map? (put shroud on not-visible area)

If you mean turn on fog of war, I think its better how it is because he can see what the enemy team is doing and give advice on what amu should of known about enemy positions, counter jungling - when shaco came early etc
